attributes.action: Cancel "Mini Exams" proposed for Year 11 and Year 13
attributes.additional_details: Firstly with the anxiety levels and mental health of the current young people we need clarity and clear understanding with regards towards exams. Exams are usually a point of anxiety - let alone when they are not confirmed. As a student I propose that the government cancel mini assessments this is because we've missed out on a lot of our education which disadvantages us. Not to mention, the added stress of revising for exams that may not even take place. 50% of mental health problems are established by age 14.
attributes.background: Give clear and decisive instructions towards teenagers regarding their exams, which are a  deciding factor towards their future.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569280.

You may also like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566760
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566803
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566569
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566894.

Exam arrangements and the current coronavirus pandemic can cause worry and stress. You can find information on how to deal with stress here:  

Young Minds: https://youngminds.org.uk 

Children’s Society: https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/mental-health-advice-for-children-and-young-people/issues-affecting-young-people   

Childline: https://www.childline.org.uk/info-advice/your-feelings/anxiety-stress-panic/coping-with-stress/
